alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 8:34PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Nevada, including the following county, Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 828 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly with 15 miles of the intersection of U.S. 95 and HWY 140 on both roadways. Between 0.5 and 1.4 inches of rain have fallen. - Along Highway 140, between 5 and 15 miles west of the intersection of U.S. 95 and HWY 140 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Eastern Humboldt County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
